results.title: Ms. Reiko Hitomi, Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Sachiko Kimura, Hiroyuki Kurita, Gian Manara, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Reiko Hitomi is a thirtyish, divorced, single parent who works as an aerobics instructor in Tokyo. The program looks at her decidedly untraditional life, her hopes and dreams as she prepares for an aerobics examination which will give her the essential qualifications to pursue her goal of running her own gym. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sachiko Kimura, Hiroyuki Kurita, Gian Manara, Nihon Hoso Kyokai, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A housewife in Seoul
results.creator_credit: You Dang-Kyu, Gian Manara, Lee Kyu-Im, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, KBS Korea and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Kim Nan-Hi is a middle-class housewife in a high rise development on the outskirts of Seoul. This program looks at her daily life, her dedication to her children’s education and the family at work and play together, illustrating the Confucian philosophy that “great happiness has been found in the small pleasures of the family”. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: You Dang-Kyu, Gian Manara, Lee Kyu-Im, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, KBS Korea and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A Woman of the outback
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Robyn Ingram lives and works with her husband and two small children on an isolated sheep station 200km. from the nearest town, Wentworth in N.S.W. The program observes Robyn at work on the farm, as teacher to her small children and on brief visits to friends on a neighbouring farm and in the city, and speculates on the pluses and minuses of such an isolated life. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: An immigrant woman
results.creator_credit: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Wong King Chan is a Chinese immigrant living and working in extremely hard conditions in Macau. Her factory work takes her away from her husband and two children for at least ten hours a day, then she returns to the tiny one room flat in a tenement building they share with three others. As we follow her daily routine we learn of her hopes to save enough money to buy a flat which will generate enough income to provide for her children’s education.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Lap Man, Gian Manara, TDM Macau, SBS-TV and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: Johura
results.creator_credit: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Johura lives on an island on a river in Bangladesh with her husband and small children. They are very poor and, to supplement their income, Johura makes an arduous journey every day into Dakkha where she works as a machinist in a textile factory. Her life is hard, yet she strives to educate her own children as well as those of the neighbouring shanties. Franca Arena introduces her story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Barkat Ullah, Gian Manara, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, BTV Bangladesh and Asian Broadcasting Union

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Woman
results.brief_description: A series narrated by Judy Morris and introduced by Franca Arena, depicting the diversity in the lives of seven individual women of the Asian and Australian region. Each episode is devoted to exploring their roles in the home, at work and within their own cultures.

results.title: A Working woman in Korea
results.creator_credit: Cheol-Yong Kang, Gian Manara, MBC Korea, Asian Broadcasting Union and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Young Hee-Kim has been working as a car saleswoman with great success for a year, but she worries about her family and whether she should be spending such long hours away from them. The program looks at the dilemma faced by working women all over the world and one woman’s attempt to come to terms with it. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheol-Yong Kang, Gian Manara, MBC Korea, Asian Broadcasting Union and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: An Indecent obsession
results.brief_description: As World War II draws to a close, Ward X is a haven for a group of emotionally wounded men and their warm, sensitive nurse, Sister Langtry. However, peace can be shattered so easily and this is the story of a woman’s obsession to duty, and the obsession she unwittingly nurtures in the men she cares for - an obsession that is inescapable. Starring Wendy Hughes.

results.title: An Ideal husband
results.creator_credit: Oliver Parker, Bruce Davey, Uri Fruchtmann, Barnaby Thompson, Pathé Frères, ICON, Fragile Films and Ideal Films (GB)
results.brief_description: Romantic comedy set in London during the late 1800’s inspired by Oscar Wilde’s play. Rupert Everett plays Arthur Goring, an upper class, womanising bachelor famed for his idleness and wit. His best friend Sir Robert Chiltern (Jeremy Northam) is a respected politician with a captivating and righteous wife (Cate Blanchett). Arthur’s loyalty and friendship is put to the test when the foundation of his friend’s idyllic marriage is threatened by the arrival of the scheming Mrs Cheveley (Julianne Moore) carrying secrets from Sir Robert’s past. Arthur finds himself caught up in a web of love, betrayal and deceit as he attempts to console his friends and protect their marriage. His actions inadvertently lead to changes in his own life and future. Also stars Minnie Driver and John Wood. Screenplay by Oliver Parker. Photography by David Johnson. Edited by Guy Bensley. Music composed by Charlie Mole.
